types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: event
fields.description: The event that occurred

fields.name: chainId
fields.description: The chain where the event occurred

fields.name: eventIndex
fields.description: The event index in the stream

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional whole numeric values.

types.name: JSONObject
types.description: A scalar that can represent any JSON Object value.

fields.name: aggregateScores
fields.description: 🚀 NEW: Trigger score aggregation from monitored player chains (for shard chains)

fields.name: updateLeaderboard
fields.description: 🚀 NEW: Trigger leaderboard update from registered shard chains (for leaderboard chains)

fields.name: updateActiveTournaments
fields.description: 🚀 NEW: Emit current active tournaments (for leaderboard chains)

fields.name: requestAggregation
fields.description: 🚀 IMPROVED: Request centralized aggregation (with client-side authorization check)

fields.name: configureTriggererCount
fields.description: 🚀 ADMIN: Configure base triggerer count

fields.name: isAuthorizedTriggerer
fields.description: 🚀 NEW: Check if a chain is authorized to trigger aggregation

fields.name: getTriggererPool
fields.description: 🚀 NEW: Get current triggerer pool for transparency

fields.name: leaderboards
fields.description: Query tournaments with optional filtering by time status (defaults to active)

fields.name: tournamentsByStatus
fields.description: Query tournaments filtered by specific status

types.name: String
types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: gameEvents
fields.description: Subscribe to all game events from any chain

fields.name: gameEventsFromChain
fields.description: Subscribe to events from a specific chain

fields.name: playerEvents
fields.description: Subscribe to events for a specific player

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: Show only currently active tournaments (default)

enumValues.name: PAST
enumValues.description: Show only past/completed tournaments

enumValues.name: FUTURE
enumValues.description: Show only future/upcoming tournaments

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: Show all tournaments regardless of time status

types.name: TriggererPool
types.description: 🚀 NEW: Triggerer pool information for clients

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type
validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution
behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally
including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing
additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description:
A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a
__DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description:
One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a
placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned
in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description:
Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which
has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description:
Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an
InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and
optionally a default value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description:
A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes
all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry
points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
description of __Schema for newer graphiql introspection schema
requirements

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description:
If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will
be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description:
If this server support subscription, the type that subscription
operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds
of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about
that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and
description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface
types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface,
provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose
other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description:
Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid
fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description:
Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are
valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: A reason for why it is deprecated, formatted using Markdown syntax

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates that an Input Object is a OneOf Input Object (and thus requires exactly one of its field be provided)

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Provides a scalar specification URL for specifying the behavior of custom scalar types.

args.name: url
args.description: URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
